issue.title: fix: fallback to copy for failed renames when generating projects
issue.body: The internals of the generate subcommand clone a repo (usually the [cloudflare/templates](https://github.com/cloudflare/templates) one) into a temp directory and then move the relevant template to the generated project, but on Linux a rename operation might not always work across devices. This meant that any Linux user trying to generate a Worker from a template would get an error no matter what. To fix this Wrangler now falls back to copying the template to the destination and then deleting the copied directory.

issue.title: Bump express from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [express](https://github.com/expressjs/express) from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2.
Release notes

Sourced from express's releases.

4.18.2

  • Fix regression routing a large stack in a single route
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1
    • deps: qs@6.11.0
    • perf: remove unnecessary object clone
  • deps: qs@6.11.0

4.18.1

  • Fix hanging on large stack of sync routes

4.18.0

  • Add "root" option to res.download
  • Allow options without filename in res.download
  • Deprecate string and non-integer arguments to res.status
  • Fix behavior of null/undefined as maxAge in res.cookie
  • Fix handling very large stacks of sync middleware
  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0
    • Fix emitted 416 error missing headers property
    • Limit the headers removed for 304 response
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: destroy@1.2.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1

... (truncated)

  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0

    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners

issue.body:
[![Mend Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| [@nativescript/core](https://nativescript.org) ([source](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript)) | [`~8.3.0` -> `~8.4.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/@nativescript%2fcore/8.3.6/8.4.1) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/@nativescript%2fcore/8.4.1/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/@nativescript%2fcore/8.4.1/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/@nativescript%2fcore/8.4.1/compatibility-slim/8.3.6)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/@nativescript%2fcore/8.4.1/confidence-slim/8.3.6)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>NativeScript/NativeScript</summary>

### [`v8.4.1`](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​841-httpsgithubcomNativeScriptNativeScriptcompare840-core841-core-2022-11-30)

##### Bug Fixes

-   **core:** circular imports of SDK_VERSION ([82d60ae](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/82d60ae057f0f14718c1065f51bf3edbf36ad96a))

### [`v8.4.0`](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​840-httpsgithubcomNativeScriptNativeScriptcompare836-core840-core-2022-11-30)

##### Features

-   **android:** support drawable in ImageSource ([#​10098](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10098)) ([75eefa6](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/75eefa669deaea09f79e4a15593f1af985a0fea1))
-   **android:** use NestedScrollView for vertical ScrollView ([#​9199](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/9199)) ([cfaa813](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/cfaa8134b0a5e4163285b1253ac4094f1bdf5b3e))
-   **core:** support css font-variation-settings ([#​9995](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/9995)) ([a5e3e22](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/a5e3e223dd037a4be8f2d5c9f2bdf3a1b5bc7d27))
-   **core:** support for external XML UI compilers ([#​10008](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10008)) ([75503ef](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/75503ef1107953737f05b8939d724fa29fac3fc4))
-   **HtmlView:** selectable property ([#​10057](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10057)) ([ca9c092](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/ca9c0928d00c97a757c33060f9fde2f6294485b5))
-   **types-android:** API Level 33 ([#​10113](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10113)) ([c1187fe](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/c1187fe5437f6f08ed189b2e8a72ed160d6c61c0))
-   **types-ios:** 16.1 ([#​10114](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10114)) ([da78e0b](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/da78e0be3f1144364829aceb8059e4af274bfd8b))
-   **utils:** dismissKeyboard, copyToClipboard, setWindowBackgroundColor, getCurrentActivity and getResource ([#​10089](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10089)) ([2e1d2c1](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/2e1d2c175b6bcd15b70c4fd119b3cc303c3799f6))
-   **webview:** adds iosAllowInlineMediaPlayback property ([#​10014](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10014)) ([4a0e1c9](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/4a0e1c9aa18ccb865ce5e3a3e5aa9b3d050562e2))
-   TypeScript 4.8+ support and NativeClass decorator improvements ([#​10081](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10081)) ([7f069a7](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/7f069a7093087a060274e59f53f68db879846b3e))

##### Bug Fixes

-   **android:** application fallback for `startActivity` ([#​10062](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10062)) ([f3a5c16](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/f3a5c16530f1b247f59960cc20280f65fdfc1715))
-   **android:** file manipulation threw exception inside worker ([#​10076](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10076)) ([25c862e](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/25c862e148668e2b6a4b7fb438615f9cc2e7ef56))
-   **android:** file system normalizePath ([#​10077](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10077)) ([497a9db](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/497a9dbaeaf953248fcb67d26196ddf7deabc8d8))
-   **android:** modal status bar props applied to wrong window ([#​10049](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10049)) ([6934645](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/6934645423eba2494c0aa5aed76b0c4b3b768be8))
-   **android:** normalize for API >= 26 ([#​10083](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10083)) ([e687e9d](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/e687e9d75650a1fc875d31fa30e4f43455e7c197))
-   **android:** tappable spans aren't visible on single-line labels ([#​10055](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10055)) ([5765707](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/57657075ca1a307556c64c13df5854ec3d378e5e))
-   **android:** ApplicationSettings return precise stored numbers ([#​10094](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10094)) ([fd98690](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/fd9869094e9f36959df5d59399ffe684be8d8e5f))
-   **android:** memory leak with EditableTextBase ([#​10052](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10052)) ([501d310](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/501d310431b19e28f75e27b16a404324a960a79a))
-   **android:** prevent flashing activity on app start ([#​9190](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/9190)) ([6a9484a](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/6a9484aaa8e77cf97426e102b2784988847fb521))
-   **android:** shared SDK_VERSION ([#​10090](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10090)) ([0226f47](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/0226f47f8d3b36fc2cc48cd1895065214fc82acb))
-   **core:** ellipsis at the end for Labels with maxLines ([#​10005](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10005)) ([6c60eab](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/6c60eab870026e970a5fee1e064e2ee8ccde476a))
-   **core:** prevent a circular reference because of `SDK_VERSION` ([#​10097](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10097)) ([c957b48](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/c957b487a8d98e529df5432aed5b7126a83a6020))
-   **core:** Color.isValid returned true for null/undefined ([#​10040](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10040)) ([9091e43](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/9091e43f036139a8f1ad2958eb0b385025204813))
-   **core:** font-weight allow passing number ([#​10072](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10072)) ([5f3f1ac](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/5f3f1ace280d7da302977ccb10d2525a48b65cf1))
-   **core:** windows build ([#​10056](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10056)) ([7860d51](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/7860d515a8f29fd9dcf07c151b7c606cb3c54e69))
-   **color:** floating point color values ([66e8e39](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/66e8e39f1e09c39a19372512ab90bd28d59691d1))
-   **core:** deprecation notes for WeakRef clear and get ([3019181](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/30191816f2fe1c9ec54bdbcbe9aa4eaac9ba11de))
-   **core:** WeakRef deprecation notes ([b83ed39](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/b83ed3939b68c0e9ee06ee9135e970969d846616))
-   **ios:** animation layer resilience ([#​10060](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10060)) ([6cabcab](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/6cabcab0d59c7eeec510fdb37de8eaf52bc8791c))
-   **ios:** Color.fromIosColor returns wrong value ([#​10059](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10059)) ([b7d340f](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/b7d340f69b9a64f44d6cc4a2a405ecfbbed78899))
-   **ios:** ensure autocorrect not applied silently on IOS16 ([#​10032](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10032)) ([40b9e35](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/40b9e3578f895b202100242643a5a7319bf528f7))
-   **ios:** frame navigatingTo event ([#​10096](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10096)) ([6148955](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/6148955335f164aa160e719a98ad811b4d006560))
-   **ios:** stability around canceling an animation ([b8d5372](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/b8d537250f5fc7e0b2a1008d049b564e302b783a))
-   **webpack:** prevent hmr from patching \__onLiveSync multiple times ([#​10103](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10103)) ([42f5dc5](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/42f5dc51c751eeb33f34cbd172533c2987df19e4))
-   **webpack:** support angular 15.x ([#​10106](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10106)) ([f100109](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/f100109e2d528aea9a389fdebe3d533878570e42))
-   **webpack:** close compiler after run ([#​10080](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10080)) ([59ca35b](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/59ca35b44b7dde4b077e5aa4aedecfb3a27e1acd))
-   **webpack:** make NativeClass transformer backwards compatible ([59624a4](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/59624a4ebe5d9bb4f42f0dd6b04c9427e0fed479))

##### Performance Improvements

-   **core:** android sdk check ([#​10084](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/issues/10084)) ([abd722c](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript/commit/abd722cd3dec73f4caa1bc15f5ae4864550a46f9))

</details>

issue.title: [docs] fix small a11y issues
issue.body:
Keeping this separate from #8069 since these are smaller fixes instead of a larger design change.

- remove duplicate text in showcase/deploy links by setting `alt=""` on the images - e.g. the link was read out as "Vercel logo Vercel" or "Screenshot of pudding.cool pudding.cool", now it's simply "Vercel" and "pudding.cool"
- make banner a <header> (resolves "all page content must be contained by landmarks warnings")
- move skip link in front of banner - it was almost entirely obscured
- treat focusing deployment links the same as hovering them (i.e. color in logo and change text color)
- label search input
- make CTRL+K a div instead of a label - it doesn't really work as a label to the search input. I considered linking it to the input with `aria-describedby` but that didn't feel correct.

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [ ] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [ ] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [ ] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [ ] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [ ] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. All changesets should be `patch` until SvelteKit 1.0

issue.title: Create new manypk/core package (feedback - DO NOT MERGE)
issue.body:
### SUMMARY

Refactor monorepo tools and associated types into a new `core` package, that can be used by both `get-packages` and `find-root`.

_This initial PR is incomplete and I've put it up to gather initial feedback on the approach; if feedback is positive I'll continue to iterate on it._

### DETAILS

Today, the process of "adding a tool" to the list of supported tools in manypkg is muddy, because the logic is spread around several packages. Goals:

 - Consolidate all logic related to finding and extracting packages from monorepos into one package.
 - Provide a concrete API for what a "monorepo tool" is, and refactor existing logic to use that API.

### TODO

Next steps / planned approach:

 - [ ] Gather initial feedback
 - [ ] Finish converting remaining tools to this new structure
 - [ ] === (Merge PR 1: Create core package) ===
 - [ ] Modify find-root and get-packages to use `manypkg/core`, and confirm all existing unit tests still pass
 - [ ] Manual validation of functionality on all supported monorepos
 - [ ] === (Merge PR 2: Conversion and publishing of changes) ===
 - [ ] Finally, rewrite all tool-specific unit tests to live on core package (close to the source)
 - [ ] Leave overarching unit tests and tests related to leftover logic in the other packages
 - [ ] === (merge PR 3: Cleanup / test improvements) ===

issue.title: Bump qs from 6.5.2 to 6.5.3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [qs](https://github.com/ljharb/qs) from 6.5.2 to 6.5.3.
Changelog

Sourced from qs's changelog.

6.5.3

  • [Fix] parse: ignore __proto__ keys (#428)
  • [Fix] utils.merge: avoid a crash with a null target and a truthy non-array source
  • [Fix] correctly parse nested arrays
  • [Fix] stringify: fix a crash with strictNullHandling and a custom filter/serializeDate (#279)
  • [Fix] utils: merge: fix crash when source is a truthy primitive & no options are provided
  • [Fix] when parseArrays is false, properly handle keys ending in []
  • [Fix] fix for an impossible situation: when the formatter is called with a non-string value
  • [Fix] utils.merge: avoid a crash with a null target and an array source
  • [Refactor] utils: reduce observable [[Get]]s
  • [Refactor] use cached Array.isArray
  • [Refactor] stringify: Avoid arr = arr.concat(...), push to the existing instance (#269)
  • [Refactor] parse: only need to reassign the var once
  • [Robustness] stringify: avoid relying on a global undefined (#427)
  • [readme] remove travis badge; add github actions/codecov badges; update URLs
  • [Docs] Clean up license text so it’s properly detected as BSD-3-Clause
  • [Docs] Clarify the need for "arrayLimit" option
  • [meta] fix README.md (#399)
  • [meta] add FUNDING.yml
  • [actions] backport actions from main
  • [Tests] always use String(x) over x.toString()
  • [Tests] remove nonexistent tape option
  • [Dev Deps] backport from main
Commits
  • 298bfa5 v6.5.3
  • ed0f5dc [Fix] parse: ignore __proto__ keys (#428)
  • 691e739 [Robustness] stringify: avoid relying on a global undefined (#427)
  • 1072d57 [readme] remove travis badge; add github actions/codecov badges; update URLs
  • 12ac1c4 [meta] fix README.md (#399)
  • 0338716 [actions] backport actions from main
  • 5639c20 Clean up license text so it’s properly detected as BSD-3-Clause
  • 51b8a0b add FUNDING.yml
  • 45f6759 [Fix] fix for an impossible situation: when the formatter is called with a no...
  • f814a7f [Dev Deps] backport from main
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

issue.title: Bump qs from 6.5.2 to 6.5.3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [qs](https://github.com/ljharb/qs) from 6.5.2 to 6.5.3.
Changelog

Sourced from qs's changelog.

6.5.3

  • [Fix] parse: ignore __proto__ keys (#428)
  • [Fix] utils.merge: avoid a crash with a null target and a truthy non-array source
  • [Fix] correctly parse nested arrays
  • [Fix] stringify: fix a crash with strictNullHandling and a custom filter/serializeDate (#279)
  • [Fix] utils: merge: fix crash when source is a truthy primitive & no options are provided
  • [Fix] when parseArrays is false, properly handle keys ending in []
  • [Fix] fix for an impossible situation: when the formatter is called with a non-string value
  • [Fix] utils.merge: avoid a crash with a null target and an array source
  • [Refactor] utils: reduce observable [[Get]]s
  • [Refactor] use cached Array.isArray
  • [Refactor] stringify: Avoid arr = arr.concat(...), push to the existing instance (#269)
  • [Refactor] parse: only need to reassign the var once
  • [Robustness] stringify: avoid relying on a global undefined (#427)
  • [readme] remove travis badge; add github actions/codecov badges; update URLs
  • [Docs] Clean up license text so it’s properly detected as BSD-3-Clause
  • [Docs] Clarify the need for "arrayLimit" option
  • [meta] fix README.md (#399)
  • [meta] add FUNDING.yml
  • [actions] backport actions from main
  • [Tests] always use String(x) over x.toString()
  • [Tests] remove nonexistent tape option
  • [Dev Deps] backport from main
Commits
  • 298bfa5 v6.5.3
  • ed0f5dc [Fix] parse: ignore __proto__ keys (#428)
  • 691e739 [Robustness] stringify: avoid relying on a global undefined (#427)
  • 1072d57 [readme] remove travis badge; add github actions/codecov badges; update URLs
  • 12ac1c4 [meta] fix README.md (#399)
  • 0338716 [actions] backport actions from main
  • 5639c20 Clean up license text so it’s properly detected as BSD-3-Clause
  • 51b8a0b add FUNDING.yml
  • 45f6759 [Fix] fix for an impossible situation: when the formatter is called with a no...
  • f814a7f [Dev Deps] backport from main

issue.title: Bump express from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [express](https://github.com/expressjs/express) from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2.
Release notes

Sourced from express's releases.

4.18.2

  • Fix regression routing a large stack in a single route
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1
    • deps: qs@6.11.0
    • perf: remove unnecessary object clone
  • deps: qs@6.11.0

4.18.1

  • Fix hanging on large stack of sync routes

4.18.0

  • Add "root" option to res.download
  • Allow options without filename in res.download
  • Deprecate string and non-integer arguments to res.status
  • Fix behavior of null/undefined as maxAge in res.cookie
  • Fix handling very large stacks of sync middleware
  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0
    • Fix emitted 416 error missing headers property
    • Limit the headers removed for 304 response
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: destroy@1.2.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1

... (truncated)

  • deps: qs@6.11.0

  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0

... (truncated)

issue.body:
Bumps [express](https://github.com/expressjs/express) from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2.
Release notes

Sourced from express's releases.

4.18.2

  • Fix regression routing a large stack in a single route
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1
    • deps: qs@6.11.0
    • perf: remove unnecessary object clone
  • deps: qs@6.11.0

4.18.1

  • Fix hanging on large stack of sync routes

4.18.0

  • Add "root" option to res.download
  • Allow options without filename in res.download
  • Deprecate string and non-integer arguments to res.status
  • Fix behavior of null/undefined as maxAge in res.cookie
  • Fix handling very large stacks of sync middleware
  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0
    • Fix emitted 416 error missing headers property
    • Limit the headers removed for 304 response
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: destroy@1.2.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1

... (truncated)

Changelog

  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1

  • deps: qs@6.11.0

4.18.1 / 2022-04-29

4.18.0 / 2022-04-25

  • Add "root" option to res.download
  • Allow options without filename in res.download
  • Deprecate string and non-integer arguments to res.status
  • Fix behavior of null/undefined as maxAge in res.cookie
  • Fix handling very large stacks of sync middleware
  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0

... (truncated)

  • 24b3dc5 deps: qs@6.11.0
  • 689d175 deps: body-parser@1.20.1

issue.title: Make dialog inert when closed
issue.body: By making the `<sl-dialog>` `inert` when closed, it prevents any element inside the dialog from gaining focus, either by TABing into it, or using a11y tooling.

issue.title: bug: v1.8 loaders have empty request.headers when called after action
issue.body:
This is a bug report: `yarn bug-report-test`

---

Prior to Remix v1.8.0 the loader function when called subsequentially to a (POST) action would have the request's `headers` set. Since v1.8 this is not the case anymore.

This is highlyt problematic. For example, if you have some high level session based cookie which is used to guard GET request in the page action (or a parent layout route); the authentication would fail every time the loaders data is retrieved subsequentially to a POST action.

issue.body:
Bumps [express](https://github.com/expressjs/express) from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2.

Sourced from express's releases.

  • Fix regression routing a large stack in a single route

4.18.1

issue.title: Set correct `$page.status` when using `enhance` and result is of type `'error'`
issue.body:
Fixes #8072 

I wanted to create a `+error.svelte` in `test/apps/basic/src/routes/actions/enhance` for this test, but somehow it is not mounted in the "js"-test. I also tried to put it in `test/apps/basic/src/routes/actions`, that also didn't work.
Furthermore, I've tried to debug with playwright debug, but couldn't find any reason why it does not work.

Updates the Eslint config to use `@guardian/eslint-config-typescript` and updates the config to ensure we're linting all files.

For now we're muting a lot of rules to allow us to fix them individually.

## Why?

We weren't actually linting any of the files in this project.

issue.title: Bump express from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [express](https://github.com/expressjs/express) from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2.
Release notes

Sourced from express's releases.

4.18.2

  • Fix regression routing a large stack in a single route
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1
    • deps: qs@6.11.0
    • perf: remove unnecessary object clone
  • deps: qs@6.11.0

4.18.1

  • Fix hanging on large stack of sync routes

4.18.0

  • Add "root" option to res.download
  • Allow options without filename in res.download
  • Deprecate string and non-integer arguments to res.status
  • Fix behavior of null/undefined as maxAge in res.cookie
  • Fix handling very large stacks of sync middleware
  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0
    • Fix emitted 416 error missing headers property
    • Limit the headers removed for 304 response
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: destroy@1.2.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1

issue.body:
[![Mend Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com) Welcome to [Renovate](https://togithub.com/renovatebot/renovate)! This is an onboarding PR to help you understand and configure settings before regular Pull Requests begin. 🚦 To activate Renovate, merge this Pull Request. To disable Renovate, simply close this Pull Request unmerged. --- ### Detected Package Files * `package.json` (npm) ### Configuration Summary Based on the default config's presets, Renovate will: - Start dependency updates only once this onboarding PR is merged - Enable Renovate Dependency Dashboard creation. - If Renovate detects semantic commits, it will use semantic commit type `fix` for dependencies and `chore` for all others. - Ignore `node_modules`, `bower_components`, `vendor` and various test/tests directories. - Autodetect whether to pin dependencies or maintain ranges. - Rate limit PR creation to a maximum of two per hour. - Limit to maximum 10 open PRs at any time. - Group known monorepo packages together. - Use curated list of recommended non-monorepo package groupings. - A collection of workarounds for known problems with packages. 🔡 Would you like to change the way Renovate is upgrading your dependencies? Simply edit the `renovate.json` in this branch with your custom config and the list of Pull Requests in the "What to Expect" section below will be updated the next time Renovate runs. --- ### What to Expect With your current configuration, Renovate will create 4 Pull Requests:
Update dependency @​nativescript/stackblitz to v0.0.6 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/nativescript-stackblitz-0.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade @​nativescript/stackblitz to `0.0.6`
Update dependency @​nativescript/core to ~8.4.0 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/nativescript-core-8.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [@nativescript/core](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript) to `~8.4.0`
Update dependency @​nativescript/types-minimal to ~8.4.0 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/nativescript-types-minimal-8.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [@nativescript/types-minimal](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript) to `~8.4.0`
Update dependency typescript to ~4.9.0 - Schedule: ["at any time"] - Branch name: `renovate/typescript-4.x` - Merge into: `main` - Upgrade [typescript](https://togithub.com/Microsoft/TypeScript) to `~4.9.0`

🚸 Branch creation will be limited to maximum 2 per hour, so it doesn't swamp any CI resources or spam the project. See docs for `prhourlylimit` for details. --- ❓ Got questions? Check out Renovate's [Docs](https://docs.renovatebot.com/), particularly the Getting Started section. If you need any further assistance then you can also [request help here](https://togithub.com/renovatebot/renovate/discussions). --- This PR has been generated by [Mend Renovate](https://www.mend.io/free-developer-tools/renovate/). View repository job log [here](https://app.renovatebot.com/dashboard#github/mhmh261/nativescript-stackblitz-templates-yy9mcxl).

issue.title: Configure Renovate
issue.body:
[![Mend Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

Welcome to [Renovate](https://togithub.com/renovatebot/renovate)! This is an onboarding PR to help you understand and configure settings before regular Pull Requests begin.

🚦 To activate Renovate, merge this Pull Request. To disable Renovate, simply close this Pull Request unmerged.



---
### Detected Package Files

 * `package.json` (npm)

### Configuration Summary

Based on the default config's presets, Renovate will:

  - Start dependency updates only once this onboarding PR is merged
  - Enable Renovate Dependency Dashboard creation.
  - If Renovate detects semantic commits, it will use semantic commit type `fix` for dependencies and `chore` for all others.
  - Ignore `node_modules`, `bower_components`, `vendor` and various test/tests directories.
  - Autodetect whether to pin dependencies or maintain ranges.
  - Rate limit PR creation to a maximum of two per hour.
  - Limit to maximum 10 open PRs at any time.
  - Group known monorepo packages together.
  - Use curated list of recommended non-monorepo package groupings.
  - A collection of workarounds for known problems with packages.

🔡 Would you like to change the way Renovate is upgrading your dependencies? Simply edit the `renovate.json` in this branch with your custom config and the list of Pull Requests in the "What to Expect" section below will be updated the next time Renovate runs.

---

### What to Expect

With your current configuration, Renovate will create 2 Pull Requests:

<details>
<summary>Update dependency @​nativescript/stackblitz to v0.0.6</summary>

  - Schedule: ["at any time"]
  - Branch name: `renovate/nativescript-stackblitz-0.x`
  - Merge into: `main`
  - Upgrade @​nativescript/stackblitz to `0.0.6`


</details>

<details>
<summary>Update dependency @​nativescript/core to ~8.4.0</summary>

  - Schedule: ["at any time"]
  - Branch name: `renovate/nativescript-core-8.x`
  - Merge into: `main`
  - Upgrade [@nativescript/core](https://togithub.com/NativeScript/NativeScript) to `~8.4.0`


</details>


---

❓ Got questions? Check out Renovate's [Docs](https://docs.renovatebot.com/), particularly the Getting Started section.
If you need any further assistance then you can also [request help here](https://togithub.com/renovatebot/renovate/discussions).


---

This PR has been generated by [Mend Renovate](https://www.mend.io/free-developer-tools/renovate/). View repository job log [here](https://app.renovatebot.com/dashboard#github/mhmh261/nativescript-stackblitz-templates-rfjnsvy).

issue.title: Bump express from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [express](https://github.com/expressjs/express) from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2.
Release notes

Sourced from express's releases.

4.18.2

  • Fix regression routing a large stack in a single route
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1
    • deps: qs@6.11.0
    • perf: remove unnecessary object clone
  • deps: qs@6.11.0

4.18.1

  • Fix hanging on large stack of sync routes

4.18.0

  • Add "root" option to res.download
  • Allow options without filename in res.download
  • Deprecate string and non-integer arguments to res.status
  • Fix behavior of null/undefined as maxAge in res.cookie
  • Fix handling very large stacks of sync middleware
  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0
    • Fix emitted 416 error missing headers property
    • Limit the headers removed for 304 response
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: destroy@1.2.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from express's changelog.

4.18.2 / 2022-10-08

  • Fix regression routing a large stack in a single route
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1
    • deps: qs@6.11.0
    • perf: remove unnecessary object clone
  • deps: qs@6.11.0

4.18.1 / 2022-04-29

  • Fix hanging on large stack of sync routes

4.18.0 / 2022-04-25

  • Add "root" option to res.download
  • Allow options without filename in res.download
  • Deprecate string and non-integer arguments to res.status
  • Fix behavior of null/undefined as maxAge in res.cookie
  • Fix handling very large stacks of sync middleware
  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 8368dc1 4.18.2
  • 61f4049 docs: replace Freenode with Libera Chat
  • bb7907b build: Node.js@18.10
  • f56ce73 build: supertest@6.3.0
  • 24b3dc5 deps: qs@6.11.0
  • 689d175 deps: body-parser@1.20.1
  • 340be0f build: eslint@8.24.0
  • 33e8dc3 docs: use Node.js name style
  • 644f646 build: supertest@6.2.4
  • ecd7572 build: Node.js@14.20
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=express&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=4.17.1&new-version=4.18.2)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/acl-services/paprika/network/alerts).

# PR Details

<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description

<!--- Describe your changes in detail -->

## Related Issue

<!--- This project only accepts pull requests related to open issues -->
<!--- If suggesting a new feature or change, please discuss it in an issue first -->
<!--- If fixing a bug, there should be an issue describing it with steps to reproduce -->
<!--- Please link to the issue here: -->

## Motivation and Context

<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->

## How Has This Been Tested

<!--- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes. -->
<!--- Include details of your testing environment, and the tests you ran to -->
<!--- see how your change affects other areas of the code, etc. -->

## Types of changes

<!--- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->

- [ ] Docs change / refactoring / dependency upgrade
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

## Checklist

<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->

- [ ] My code follows the code style of this project.
- [ ] I have updated changeset
- [ ] My change requires a change to the documentation.
- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly.
- [ ] I have read the **CONTRIBUTING** document.
- [ ] I have added tests to cover my changes.
- [ ] All new and existing tests passed.

issue.title: Bump qs from 6.5.2 to 6.5.3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [qs](https://github.com/ljharb/qs) from 6.5.2 to 6.5.3.
Changelog

Sourced from qs's changelog.

6.5.3

  • [Fix] parse: ignore __proto__ keys (#428)
  • [Fix] utils.merge: avoid a crash with a null target and a truthy non-array source
  • [Fix] correctly parse nested arrays
  • [Fix] stringify: fix a crash with strictNullHandling and a custom filter/serializeDate (#279)
  • [Fix] utils: merge: fix crash when source is a truthy primitive & no options are provided
  • [Fix] when parseArrays is false, properly handle keys ending in []
  • [Fix] fix for an impossible situation: when the formatter is called with a non-string value
  • [Fix] utils.merge: avoid a crash with a null target and an array source
  • [Refactor] utils: reduce observable [[Get]]s
  • [Refactor] use cached Array.isArray
  • [Refactor] stringify: Avoid arr = arr.concat(...), push to the existing instance (#269)
  • [Refactor] parse: only need to reassign the var once
  • [Robustness] stringify: avoid relying on a global undefined (#427)
  • [readme] remove travis badge; add github actions/codecov badges; update URLs
  • [Docs] Clean up license text so it’s properly detected as BSD-3-Clause
  • [Docs] Clarify the need for "arrayLimit" option
  • [meta] fix README.md (#399)
  • [meta] add FUNDING.yml
  • [actions] backport actions from main
  • [Tests] always use String(x) over x.toString()
  • [Tests] remove nonexistent tape option
  • [Dev Deps] backport from main
Commits
  • 298bfa5 v6.5.3
  • ed0f5dc [Fix] parse: ignore __proto__ keys (#428)
  • 691e739 [Robustness] stringify: avoid relying on a global undefined (#427)
  • 1072d57 [readme] remove travis badge; add github actions/codecov badges; update URLs
  • 12ac1c4 [meta] fix README.md (#399)
  • 0338716 [actions] backport actions from main
  • 5639c20 Clean up license text so it’s properly detected as BSD-3-Clause
  • 51b8a0b add FUNDING.yml
  • 45f6759 [Fix] fix for an impossible situation: when the formatter is called with a no...
  • f814a7f [Dev Deps] backport from main
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=qs&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=6.5.2&new-version=6.5.3)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. issue.title: Bump qs from 6.5.2 to 6.5.3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [qs](https://github.com/ljharb/qs) from 6.5.2 to 6.5.3.
Changelog

Sourced from qs's changelog.

6.5.3

  • [Fix] parse: ignore __proto__ keys (#428)
  • [Fix] utils.merge: avoid a crash with a null target and a truthy non-array source
  • [Fix] correctly parse nested arrays
  • [Fix] stringify: fix a crash with strictNullHandling and a custom filter/serializeDate (#279)
  • [Fix] utils: merge: fix crash when source is a truthy primitive & no options are provided
  • [Fix] when parseArrays is false, properly handle keys ending in []
  • [Fix] fix for an impossible situation: when the formatter is called with a non-string value
  • [Fix] utils.merge: avoid a crash with a null target and an array source
  • [Refactor] utils: reduce observable [[Get]]s
  • [Refactor] use cached Array.isArray
  • [Refactor] stringify: Avoid arr = arr.concat(...), push to the existing instance (#269)
  • [Refactor] parse: only need to reassign the var once
  • [Robustness] stringify: avoid relying on a global undefined (#427)
  • [readme] remove travis badge; add github actions/codecov badges; update URLs
  • [Docs] Clean up license text so it’s properly detected as BSD-3-Clause
  • [Docs] Clarify the need for "arrayLimit" option
  • [meta] fix README.md (#399)
  • [meta] add FUNDING.yml
  • [actions] backport actions from main
  • [Tests] always use String(x) over x.toString()
  • [Tests] remove nonexistent tape option
  • [Dev Deps] backport from main
Commits
  • 298bfa5 v6.5.3
  • ed0f5dc [Fix] parse: ignore __proto__ keys (#428)
  • 691e739 [Robustness] stringify: avoid relying on a global undefined (#427)
  • 1072d57 [readme] remove travis badge; add github actions/codecov badges; update URLs
  • 12ac1c4 [meta] fix README.md (#399)
  • 0338716 [actions] backport actions from main
  • 5639c20 Clean up license text so it’s properly detected as BSD-3-Clause
  • 51b8a0b add FUNDING.yml
  • 45f6759 [Fix] fix for an impossible situation: when the formatter is called with a no...
  • f814a7f [Dev Deps] backport from main
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

issue.title: WIP: V3

milestone.title: Mappersmith v3
milestone.description:
Work happening in branch `v3`

Overhaul of deprecated APIs, repo structure, npm packages, etc

Repo organisation
- Rename `master` to `main`
- Remove volta
- Workspaces
  - Make `mappersmith/test` a separate package
  - Make each bundled middleware a separate package

Release
- Stop bundling prebuilt web
  - kill `webpack`
  - kill `build:browser`

Deprecations
- Kill all deprecated code
  - `middlewares`
  -  `Context`, `setContext`
  - `Options`
  - `request` 

Legacy
- Get rid of `Promise` as a configurable

issue.title: Bump qs from 6.5.2 to 6.5.3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [qs](https://github.com/ljharb/qs) from 6.5.2 to 6.5.3.
Changelog

Sourced from qs's changelog.

6.5.3

  • [Fix] parse: ignore __proto__ keys (#428)
  • [Fix] utils.merge: avoid a crash with a null target and a truthy non-array source
  • [Fix] correctly parse nested arrays
  • [Fix] stringify: fix a crash with strictNullHandling and a custom filter/serializeDate (#279)
  • [Fix] utils: merge: fix crash when source is a truthy primitive & no options are provided
  • [Fix] when parseArrays is false, properly handle keys ending in []
  • [Fix] fix for an impossible situation: when the formatter is called with a non-string value
  • [Fix] utils.merge: avoid a crash with a null target and an array source
  • [Refactor] utils: reduce observable [[Get]]s
  • [Refactor] use cached Array.isArray
  • [Refactor] stringify: Avoid arr = arr.concat(...), push to the existing instance (#269)
  • [Refactor] parse: only need to reassign the var once
  • [Robustness] stringify: avoid relying on a global undefined (#427)
  • [readme] remove travis badge; add github actions/codecov badges; update URLs
  • [Docs] Clean up license text so it’s properly detected as BSD-3-Clause
  • [Docs] Clarify the need for "arrayLimit" option
  • [meta] fix README.md (#399)
  • [meta] add FUNDING.yml
  • [actions] backport actions from main
  • [Tests] always use String(x) over x.toString()
  • [Tests] remove nonexistent tape option
  • [Dev Deps] backport from main
Commits
  • 298bfa5 v6.5.3
  • ed0f5dc [Fix] parse: ignore __proto__ keys (#428)
  • 691e739 [Robustness] stringify: avoid relying on a global undefined (#427)
  • 1072d57 [readme] remove travis badge; add github actions/codecov badges; update URLs
  • 12ac1c4 [meta] fix README.md (#399)
  • 0338716 [actions] backport actions from main
  • 5639c20 Clean up license text so it’s properly detected as BSD-3-Clause
  • 51b8a0b add FUNDING.yml
  • 45f6759 [Fix] fix for an impossible situation: when the formatter is called with a no...
  • f814a7f [Dev Deps] backport from main
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

issue.title: Bump express from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2 in /packages/web

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [express](https://github.com/expressjs/express) from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2.
Release notes

Sourced from express's releases.

4.18.2

  • Fix regression routing a large stack in a single route
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1
    • deps: qs@6.11.0
    • perf: remove unnecessary object clone
  • deps: qs@6.11.0

4.18.1

  • Fix hanging on large stack of sync routes

4.18.0

  • Add "root" option to res.download
  • Allow options without filename in res.download
  • Deprecate string and non-integer arguments to res.status
  • Fix behavior of null/undefined as maxAge in res.cookie
  • Fix handling very large stacks of sync middleware
  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3

issue.title: Bump express from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2 in /packages/studio

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [express](https://github.com/expressjs/express) from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2.
Release notes

Sourced from express's releases.

4.18.2

  • Fix regression routing a large stack in a single route
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1
    • deps: qs@6.11.0
    • perf: remove unnecessary object clone
  • deps: qs@6.11.0

4.18.1

  • Fix hanging on large stack of sync routes

4.18.0

  • Add "root" option to res.download
  • Allow options without filename in res.download
  • Deprecate string and non-integer arguments to res.status
  • Fix behavior of null/undefined as maxAge in res.cookie
  • Fix handling very large stacks of sync middleware
  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0
    • Fix emitted 416 error missing headers property
    • Limit the headers removed for 304 response
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: destroy@1.2.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1

... (truncated)

Changelog

4.18.2 / 2022-10-08

  • Fix regression routing a large stack in a single route
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1
    • deps: qs@6.11.0

  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0

issue.title: Bump express from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [express](https://github.com/expressjs/express) from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2.
Release notes

Sourced from express's releases.

4.18.2

  • Fix regression routing a large stack in a single route
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1
    • deps: qs@6.11.0
    • perf: remove unnecessary object clone
  • deps: qs@6.11.0

4.18.1

  • Fix hanging on large stack of sync routes

4.18.0

  • Add "root" option to res.download
  • Allow options without filename in res.download
  • Deprecate string and non-integer arguments to res.status
  • Fix behavior of null/undefined as maxAge in res.cookie
  • Fix handling very large stacks of sync middleware
  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0
    • Fix emitted 416 error missing headers property
    • Limit the headers removed for 304 response
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: destroy@1.2.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1

... (truncated)

Changelog

4.18.2 / 2022-10-08

  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1

  • Allow options without filename in res.download

  • Fix behavior of null/undefined as maxAge in res.cookie
  • Fix handling very large stacks of sync middleware
  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 8368dc1 4.18.2
  • 61f4049 docs: replace Freenode with Libera Chat
  • bb7907b build: Node.js@18.10
  • f56ce73 build: supertest@6.3.0
  • 24b3dc5 deps: qs@6.11.0
  • 689d175 deps: body-parser@1.20.1
  • 340be0f build: eslint@8.24.0
  • 33e8dc3 docs: use Node.js name style
  • 644f646 build: supertest@6.2.4
  • ecd7572 build: Node.js@14.20
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

issue.title: [fix] make `<li> <code>` elements in docs scrollable
issue.body:
Continuation of #8034 and #8056

I missed code blocks in _list-items_ when I did the last PR.

Problem can be seen in this section:
https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/adapters#writing-custom-adapters

This little addition should take care of that.

issue.title: fix: fallback to copy for failed renames when generating projects
issue.body: The internals of the generate subcommand clone a repo (usually the [cloudflare/templates](https://github.com/cloudflare/templates) one) into a temp directory and then move the relevant template to the generated project, but on Linux a rename operation might not always work across devices. This meant that any Linux user trying to generate a Worker from a template would get an error no matter what. To fix this Wrangler now falls back to copying the template to the destination and then deleting the copied directory.

issue.title: [docs] fix small a11y issues
issue.body:
Keeping this separate from #8069 since these are smaller fixes instead of a larger design change.

- remove duplicate text in showcase/deploy links by setting `alt=""` on the images - e.g. the link was read out as "Vercel logo Vercel" or "Screenshot of pudding.cool pudding.cool", now it's simply "Vercel" and "pudding.cool"
- make banner a <header> (resolves "all page content must be contained by landmarks warnings")
- move skip link in front of banner - it was almost entirely obscured
- treat focusing deployment links the same as hovering them (i.e. color in logo and change text color)
- label search input
- make CTRL+K a div instead of a label - it doesn't really work as a label to the search input. I considered linking it to the input with `aria-describedby` but that didn't feel correct.

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [ ] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [ ] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [ ] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [ ] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [ ] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. All changesets should be `patch` until SvelteKit 1.0

issue.title: Create new manypk/core package (feedback - DO NOT MERGE)
issue.body:
### SUMMARY

Refactor monorepo tools and associated types into a new `core` package, that can be used by both `get-packages` and `find-root`.

_This initial PR is incomplete and I've put it up to gather initial feedback on the approach; if feedback is positive I'll continue to iterate on it._

### DETAILS

Today, the process of "adding a tool" to the list of supported tools in manypkg is muddy, because the logic is spread around several packages. Goals:

 - Consolidate all logic related to finding and extracting packages from monorepos into one package.
 - Provide a concrete API for what a "monorepo tool" is, and refactor existing logic to use that API.

### TODO

Next steps / planned approach:

 - [ ] Gather initial feedback
 - [ ] Finish converting remaining tools to this new structure
 - [ ] === (Merge PR 1: Create core package) ===
 - [ ] Modify find-root and get-packages to use `manypkg/core`, and confirm all existing unit tests still pass
 - [ ] Manual validation of functionality on all supported monorepos
 - [ ] === (Merge PR 2: Conversion and publishing of changes) ===
 - [ ] Finally, rewrite all tool-specific unit tests to live on core package (close to the source)
 - [ ] Leave overarching unit tests and tests related to leftover logic in the other packages
 - [ ] === (merge PR 3: Cleanup / test improvements) ===

issue.title: Bump qs from 6.5.2 to 6.5.3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [qs](https://github.com/ljharb/qs) from 6.5.2 to 6.5.3.
Changelog

Sourced from qs's changelog.

6.5.3

  • [Fix] parse: ignore __proto__ keys (#428)
  • [Fix] utils.merge: avoid a crash with a null target and a truthy non-array source
  • [Fix] correctly parse nested arrays
  • [Fix] stringify: fix a crash with strictNullHandling and a custom filter/serializeDate (#279)
  • [Fix] utils: merge: fix crash when source is a truthy primitive & no options are provided
  • [Fix] when parseArrays is false, properly handle keys ending in []
  • [Fix] fix for an impossible situation: when the formatter is called with a non-string value
  • [Fix] utils.merge: avoid a crash with a null target and an array source
  • [Refactor] utils: reduce observable [[Get]]s
  • [Refactor] use cached Array.isArray
  • [Refactor] stringify: Avoid arr = arr.concat(...), push to the existing instance (#269)
  • [Refactor] parse: only need to reassign the var once
  • [Robustness] stringify: avoid relying on a global undefined (#427)
  • [readme] remove travis badge; add github actions/codecov badges; update URLs
  • [Docs] Clean up license text so it’s properly detected as BSD-3-Clause
  • [Docs] Clarify the need for "arrayLimit" option
  • [meta] fix README.md (#399)
  • [meta] add FUNDING.yml
  • [actions] backport actions from main
  • [Tests] always use String(x) over x.toString()
  • [Tests] remove nonexistent tape option
  • [Dev Deps] backport from main
Commits
  • 298bfa5 v6.5.3
  • ed0f5dc [Fix] parse: ignore __proto__ keys (#428)
  • 691e739 [Robustness] stringify: avoid relying on a global undefined (#427)
  • 1072d57 [readme] remove travis badge; add github actions/codecov badges; update URLs
  • 12ac1c4 [meta] fix README.md (#399)
  • 0338716 [actions] backport actions from main
  • 5639c20 Clean up license text so it’s properly detected as BSD-3-Clause
  • 51b8a0b add FUNDING.yml
  • 45f6759 [Fix] fix for an impossible situation: when the formatter is called with a no...
  • f814a7f [Dev Deps] backport from main
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

issue.title: Bump qs from 6.5.2 to 6.5.3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [qs](https://github.com/ljharb/qs) from 6.5.2 to 6.5.3.
Changelog

Sourced from qs's changelog.

6.5.3

  • [Fix] parse: ignore __proto__ keys (#428)
  • [Fix] utils.merge: avoid a crash with a null target and a truthy non-array source
  • [Fix] correctly parse nested arrays
  • [Fix] stringify: fix a crash with strictNullHandling and a custom filter/serializeDate (#279)
  • [Fix] utils: merge: fix crash when source is a truthy primitive & no options are provided
  • [Fix] when parseArrays is false, properly handle keys ending in []
  • [Fix] fix for an impossible situation: when the formatter is called with a non-string value
  • [Fix] utils.merge: avoid a crash with a null target and an array source
  • [Refactor] utils: reduce observable [[Get]]s
  • [Refactor] use cached Array.isArray
  • [Refactor] stringify: Avoid arr = arr.concat(...), push to the existing instance (#269)
  • [Refactor] parse: only need to reassign the var once
  • [Robustness] stringify: avoid relying on a global undefined (#427)
  • [readme] remove travis badge; add github actions/codecov badges; update URLs
  • [Docs] Clean up license text so it’s properly detected as BSD-3-Clause
  • [Docs] Clarify the need for "arrayLimit" option
  • [meta] fix README.md (#399)
  • [meta] add FUNDING.yml
  • [actions] backport actions from main
  • [Tests] always use String(x) over x.toString()
  • [Tests] remove nonexistent tape option
  • [Dev Deps] backport from main
Commits
  • 298bfa5 v6.5.3
  • ed0f5dc [Fix] parse: ignore __proto__ keys (#428)
  • 691e739 [Robustness] stringify: avoid relying on a global undefined (#427)
  • 1072d57 [readme] remove travis badge; add github actions/codecov badges; update URLs
  • 12ac1c4 [meta] fix README.md (#399)
  • 0338716 [actions] backport actions from main
  • 5639c20 Clean up license text so it’s properly detected as BSD-3-Clause
  • 51b8a0b add FUNDING.yml

issue.title: Bump express from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [express](https://github.com/expressjs/express) from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2.
Release notes

Sourced from express's releases.

4.18.2

  • Fix regression routing a large stack in a single route
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1
    • deps: qs@6.11.0
    • perf: remove unnecessary object clone
  • deps: qs@6.11.0

4.18.1

  • Fix hanging on large stack of sync routes

4.18.0

  • Add "root" option to res.download
  • Allow options without filename in res.download
  • Deprecate string and non-integer arguments to res.status
  • Fix behavior of null/undefined as maxAge in res.cookie
  • Fix handling very large stacks of sync middleware
  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0
    • Fix emitted 416 error missing headers property
    • Limit the headers removed for 304 response
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: destroy@1.2.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1

... (truncated)

    • deps: depd@2.0.0

    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1

    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1

  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0

issue.title: Bump express from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [express](https://github.com/expressjs/express) from 4.17.1 to 4.18.2.
Release notes

Sourced from express's releases.

4.18.2

  • Fix regression routing a large stack in a single route
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1
    • deps: qs@6.11.0
    • perf: remove unnecessary object clone
  • deps: qs@6.11.0

4.18.1

  • Fix hanging on large stack of sync routes

4.18.0

  • Add "root" option to res.download
  • Allow options without filename in res.download
  • Deprecate string and non-integer arguments to res.status
  • Fix behavior of null/undefined as maxAge in res.cookie
  • Fix handling very large stacks of sync middleware
  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0
    • Fix emitted 416 error missing headers property
    • Limit the headers removed for 304 response
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: destroy@1.2.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from express's changelog.

4.18.2 / 2022-10-08

  • Fix regression routing a large stack in a single route
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.1
    • deps: qs@6.11.0

  • deps: qs@6.11.0

4.18.1 / 2022-04-29

  • Fix hanging on large stack of sync routes

4.18.0 / 2022-04-25

  • Add "root" option to res.download
  • Allow options without filename in res.download
  • Deprecate string and non-integer arguments to res.status
  • Fix behavior of null/undefined as maxAge in res.cookie
  • Fix handling very large stacks of sync middleware
  • Ignore Object.prototype values in settings through app.set/app.get
  • Invoke default with same arguments as types in res.format
  • Support proper 205 responses using res.send
  • Use http-errors for res.format error
  • deps: body-parser@1.20.0
    • Fix error message for json parse whitespace in strict
    • Fix internal error when inflated body exceeds limit
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
    • Prevent hanging when request already read
    • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • deps: http-errors@2.0.0
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: qs@6.10.3
    • deps: raw-body@2.5.1
  • deps: cookie@0.5.0
    • Add priority option
    • Fix expires option to reject invalid dates
  • deps: depd@2.0.0
    • Replace internal eval usage with Function constructor
    • Use instance methods on process to check for listeners
  • deps: finalhandler@1.2.0
    • Remove set content headers that break response
    • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • deps: statuses@2.0.1
  • deps: on-finished@2.4.1
    • Prevent loss of async hooks context
  • deps: qs@6.10.3
  • deps: send@0.18.0

... (truncated)

Commits

  • 61f4049 docs: replace Freenode with Libera Chat
  • bb7907b build: Node.js@18.10

  • 24b3dc5 deps: qs@6.11.0
  • 689d175 deps: body-parser@1.20.1
  • 340be0f build: eslint@8.24.0

issue.title: Make dialog inert when closed
issue.body: By making the `<sl-dialog>` `inert` when closed, it prevents any element inside the dialog from gaining focus, either by TABing into it, or using a11y tooling.

issue.title: bug: v1.8 loaders have empty request.headers when called after action
issue.body:
This is a bug report: `yarn bug-report-test`

---

Prior to Remix v1.8.0 the loader function when called subsequentially to a (POST) action would have the request's `headers` set. Since v1.8 this is not the case anymore.

This is highlyt problematic. For example, if you have some high level session based cookie which is used to guard GET request in the page action (or a parent layout route); the authentication would fail every time the loaders data is retrieved subsequentially to a POST action.

Fixes #8072 

I wanted to create a `+error.svelte` in `test/apps/basic/src/routes/actions/enhance` for this test, but somehow it is not mounted in the "js"-test. I also tried to put it in `test/apps/basic/src/routes/actions`, that also didn't work.
Furthermore, I've tried to debug with playwright debug, but couldn't find any reason why it does not work.

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
